Madison is appointed as a member of the House of Representatives and is tasked with ensuring that the new government works as it should. He faces opposition from his political opponents and struggles to balance his personal beliefs with the needs of the government.

In the new Congress, Madison has to navigate his way through the tricky waters of partisan politics. He works hard to ensure that the government runs smoothly, but he faces opposition from his political opponents, including some members of his own party. Madison is also forced to confront the issue of slavery once again when he faces opposition from Southern Democrats who want to strengthen slavery laws.

As the years pass, Madison rises to prominence in Congress and becomes a key player in American politics. He faces new challenges and conflicts, including the War of 1812, which tests his leadership skills and his commitment to the nation. The show portrays the various struggles that Madison had to face, including his personal life and relationships with his colleagues.
